title: Man United news: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer 'ready to break transfer policy' to get Mario Mandzukic
text:
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is ready to 'break Manchester United's transfer policy' in a bid to solve the club's striker shortage.

Injuries to Marcus Rashford and Anthony Martial have seen United left exposed in the striker department with more pressure being placed on 17-year-old star Mason Greenwood following Romelu Lukaku's summer exit.

The Belgian was not replaced and the Metro report that Solskjaer is now ready to go against his policy of signing young players with 33-year-old Mario Mandzukic a primary target for January.

Manchester United are reportedly considering another move to sign striker Mario Mandzukic

Ole Gunar Solskjaer's decision not to replace Romelu Lukaku has left him short of options

Solskjaer has focused on acquiring young, homegrown players with future sell-on ability.

The United boss picked up Daniel James from Swansea City before adding 21-year-old full-back Aaron Wan-Bissaka from Crystal Palace.

He also spent big to bring England international defender Harry Maguire to the club in an £80million move from Leicester City.

Injuries have seen more pressure put on 17-year-old ace Mason Greenwood to score the goals

But having made a conscious effort to bolster the defence, it is his striking options that have been most exposed just seven games into the season.

Martial has been sidelined since picking up a thigh injury in the home defeat to Crystal Palace while Rashford spent time out before returning in recent games.

Goals have been tough to come by with just nine goals scored by United so far - four of which came in the opening game against Chelsea.

United were reported to be in discussions with Mandzukic in the summer after it became clear he has been deemed surplus to requirements by Maurizio Sarri at Juventus, but the two sides were unable to reach an agreement.

The Croatian forward was left out of Juventus' Champions League squad and will seek an exit in January in a bid to gain some game-time with United one option given their striker shortage.

Jesse Lingard became the latest injury scare after he was forced off in Thursday's Europa League stalemate against AZ Alkmaar and he could miss Sunday's match against strugglers Newcastle United.
description: Injuries to Marcus Rashford and Anthony Martial have seen United left exposed in the striker department with more pressure being placed on 17-year-old star Mason Greenwood.
